story:
Before March 11, 2011, virtually no one had heard of Fukushima, Japan. Now, everyone should know, because it has created a juggernaut which is sending us into nothing less than destruction of our planet and humanity. The 9.0 earthquake and ensuing tsunami on that fateful day, caused the meltdown of three nuclear reactors and great damage to a fourth of six reactors that had been arrogantly built on a dangerous fault line. Tremendous radiation pours daily from Fukushima, dumping 300 tons of radioactive water into the Pacific Ocean. Tuna caught off the California coast has been tested and shows high concentrations of radiation. Babies being born in the Western United States have a high incidence of hypothyroidism. Scientists document massive disappearances of sea life. Former UN advisor Akio Matsumura says that removing the radioactive material from the Fukushima fuel pools is an ‘issue of human survival.’

Besides the obvious problem of the radiation, the truth is being hidden from the public, possibly to protect the Tokyo Olympics in 2020, or so people are not frightened and continue to spend money as if nothing has happened. The cruel truth is that the planet will die if the radiation problem is not addressed and addressed quickly. Awareness is the key, and there are solutions. Einstein said that a problem cannot be fixed from the same level where it was created. The solutions are quantum and come from the energy of the shift in consciousness we have experienced here on this planet. Energy pours from the heart of the galaxy as documented by NASA, the sun has just reversed its magnetic field and photons flow into the planet whenever there is a solar flare. Quantum physics demonstrates that our thoughts create reality and there are incredible advances in energy medicine and other quantum technology.

I wrote READY OR NOT HERE IT COMES as a crash course to the shift in consciousness, to assist in personal and planetary transformation. I blog at www.readyornothereitcomes.wordpress.com. I was blessed to connect with Monique El, a SCIO specialist, working with quantum biofeedback. We are dedicated to bringing awareness to Fukushima and to also providing solutions. We are fundraising so we can do workshops around the United States and around the world, providing people with resources and tools to participate in the healing of our beautiful planet and to assure the health of everyone on the planet. Donate today, the life you save may be your own, or that of a loved one.  Even $1 helps!

story:
Who are we?

Sustainable Cycles is a collective of spokeswomen who travel the country by bicycle spreading the word about sustainable menstrual products. Through leading workshops and engaging in one-on-one conversations, we seek to break down the cultural taboo surrounding menstruation and help women make the switch to methods such as menstrual cups, reusable pads, and sponges - methods that save women a whole lot of money, worry, and trash.

The project was started in 2011 by Sarah Konner and Toni Craige, who biked down the West Coast meeting with groups of women to talk about periods and offer alternatives to single-use pads and tampons. This spring, 7 women will traverse the US along three different routes  in order to converge in Boston at the Society for Menstrual Cycle Research’s National Conference at the beginning of June.

We - Heather and Rachel - will be bicycling up the east coast from Key West, Florida to Boston, Massachusetts, facilitating conversations about menstruation and sustainable, healthy ways of engaging with our cycles.

Why donate?

While in some ancient cultures, menstruation was seen as a sacred time of month, in modern times getting one’s period can feel like more of a burden than a gift. Across the world, menstruation presents challenges for women and girls. An average woman will spend $2000-$3000 on her period and use 12,000-16,000 disposable products over the course of her life. For low-income women, having their cycles can be trying because food stamps do not cover pads and tampons. In some places, menstruation is a primary cause of girls missing or dropping out of school. Switching to reusable options gives women long-lasting support for their cycles. It can mean spending under $100 for a lifetime’s worth of supplies, no longer worrying about the risk of Toxic Shock Syndrome or putting chemically bleached materials in their bodies, and ditching the constant contributions to the landfill. Not only are sustainable methods cost effective and convenient, but they can be hugely empowering on an emotional level as well.

Removing the stigma around menstruation could be one of the most helpful things that we can do. So we’re embarking on a two month trip to offer tangible alternatives and get people together to talk, learn, listen and share stories about one of the most intimate parts of our lives. These conversations are a doorway to honest and frank discussion about bleeding and how to cope with it. This person-to-person revolution aims to help people find empowering ways of handling their cycles while supporting a healthier planet and the movement for women's empowerment that is taking place worldwide. 

By contributing to this campaign, you are supporting a shift towards more environmental and health-conscious practices as well as open discourse surrounding women’s bodies. The funds we receive will help us cover the cost of bicycle maintenance, food, equipment, and transportation to our start location. Sustainable Cycles has already helped hundreds of women change the way they live with their cycles. Help us continue the movement!

Other ways to contribute

We will gladly accept contributions in the form of lightweight camping gear, bicycling gear and maintenance supplies! Please contact us if you would like to help out in this way.

In addition, we are looking for connections to people or communities along our route who would be interested in hosting an event! If you know of an individual, health center, bicycle coalition, social justice/environmental/student organization or any other group who may be interested, please get in touch!

Our route includes (but is not limited to):

Key West, FL - Miami  - Jacksonville - Savannah, GA - Charleston, SC - Wilmington, NC - Raleigh/Durham - Winston-Salem - Blacksburg, VA - Harrisonburg - Charlottesville - Richmond - Washington DC - Baltimore - Philadelphia - New York - Boston

You can also help by talking about these ideas with your friends and family, and by spreading the word about the project. 

Thank you for your support!

story:
SEA LEVEL RISE PSA ANIMATION

Click to view our 2012 Sea Level Rise Animation

There is no doubt that we are now experiencing the effects of our changing climate globally. Coastal communities particularly are feeling the impacts due to sea level rise. While media attention is increasing, there is a tremendous need to raise the public’s awareness of this issue. Sea level rise will impact millions of Americans and threaten billions of dollars of infrastructure and coastline.

Both nationally and globally, the problems we face with sea level rise will impact almost all facets of life: how we maintain and enjoy our beaches; how we insure and protect our homes and communities, how we revitalize our economy and how we create a sustainable future. We know that Florida is especially vulnerable with more than 1,200 miles of coastline, almost 4,500 square miles of estuaries and bays, and most of Florida’s 18 million residents living less than 60 miles from the Atlantic Ocean or the Gulf of Mexico. 


WHY DO WE NEED YOUR HELP?

We believe that action is imperative and that public understanding of the issues and impacts of sea level rise are critical. We are working to create a simulated animated video that will raise public awareness, but we need your help. Funds raised will help support the production of a photorealistic 3D animation to simulate the effects of sea level rise from the point of view of an individual. A comparison will be made between our current environment and the future environment post-sea level rise. We will work to ensure wide distribution of the final product to reach as broad an audience as possible including community members and decision makers.

Click to view our 2012 Sea Level Rise Animation

WHO ARE WE?

We are a group of students and individuals involved in digital production and digital visualization with an educational background in Architecture. We previously produced an animated video for Florida Atlantic University’s (FAU) 2012 Sea Level Rise Summit on the effects of sea level rise in Miami, which received considerable attention. In addition, we have been involved in film & animation, produced an animated short film Firefly and the Coffee Machine which has won awards at various prestigious film festivals.

Our goal is to have this video complete in time for FAU’s 2013 Sea Level Rise Summit: Resiliency in the Face of Change, being held in Fort Lauderdale the week of October 16th in conjunction with the Association of Collegiate Schools of Architecture Subtropical Cities Conference.

Click to view our 2012 Sea Level Rise Animation

story:
TCG Dumlupınar, 4 Nisan1953 günü I. İnönü denizaltısı ile AkdenizdekiNATOBlue Sea tatbikatından dönerken 86 kişilik mürettebatı ile batan Türk denizaltısı.


Çanakkale'nin 84m dibinde yıllardır çıkarılmayı bekliyor! Bu kampanyamıza sizde destek olun, TCG DUMLUPINAR Tarihiyle gün yüzüne çıksın!

-------------------

USS Blower (SS-325), a Balao-class submarine, was a ship of the United States Navy named for the blower, a fish of the Atlantic coast of the United States and the West Indies.

Blower (SS-325) was launched 23 April 1944 by Electric Boat Co., Groton, Conn.; sponsored by Mrs. Richard F. J. Johnson, wife of Commander Johnson, and commissioned 10 August 1944, Lieutenant Commander J. H. Campbell in command.

Blower arrived at Pearl Harbor 16 December 1944 and, after undergoing voyage repairs and training exercises got underway for her first war patrol 17 January 1945. She completed three war patrols before the termination of hostilities, all in the Java and South China seas. All three patrols proved unprofitable for Blower and she arrived at Fremantle, Australia, from her last patrol 28 July 1945. Blower departed the Southwest Pacific in September 1945 and, after engaging in training exercises around the Marianas and Caroline Islands for several months, proceeded to the United States via Pearl Harbor, arriving at San Diego 29 January 1946.

From 1946 through 1949 Blower was attached to the Submarine Force, Pacific Fleet. She operated mainly along the west coast on scheduled torpedo exercises submerged sound school operations, and training programs. During the latter part of 1946 she made a cruise to Japan, via Pearl Harbor and the Marianas. Early in 1947 she participated in fleet operations near Pearl Harbor.

During August–September 1948 Blower operated in Alaskan waters with Carp (SS-338) patrolling along the contour of the Arctic ice pack in the Chukchi Sea, carrying out radar tracking and sonar exercises. Returning to San Diego, the ship continued scheduled operations until early 1950 when she departed for the east coast to join Submarine Force, Atlantic Fleet. She arrived at Philadelphia 3 March and underwent repairs at the Philadelphia Naval Shipyard until September. On 27 September she arrived at New London, Connecticut, where she trained Turkish naval personnel.

TCG Dumlupınar

Blower was decommissioned at the Naval Submarine Base New London, 16 November 1950 and transferred to Turkey under the Mutual Defense Assistance Program, where she was recommissioned as the second TCG Dumlupınar. She was lost on 4 April 1953, when, returning from the NATO maneuver Blue-Sea, TCG Dumlupınar collided in the Dardanelles off the Nara Point with the Swedish freighter Naboland and sank. Eighty-one submariners died in this accident.

The story of Dumlupinar unfolded on 4 April 1953, while returning from the Nato training mission "Blue Sea", she collided with the Swedish cargo ship Naboland in Nara region, Canakkale (Dardanelles) and sank. Presently she is lying in 90 meters depth.

TCG Inonu I and TCG Dumlupinar submarines started their voyage home to Golcuk after completing their missions in the Nato training in Mediterranean. In the night of April 3/4, they passed Canakkale straits returning home without knowing what will happen. The trip for Dumlupinar has ended with a tragic accident at April 4, 1953 02:10 a.m. with a tragic accident.

Lieutenant Huseyin Inkaya was on the deck watch continuing his duty although he was not on shift. While they were near Nara, something strange caught his eyes on their course. Right at that moment, there was a loud noise that none understand where came from and the soldiers fall to the sea. Only the five of the eight watch crew that where on the deck while collision were lucky to open their eyes in water. The two of them died terribly with the propellers of Dumlupinar and one of sailors was drowned.Swedish steamer SS Naboland was collieded to Dumlupinar from her bow torpedo room starboard side. The sound of the collision has been heard from the ships anchored in the Eceabat harbor. Dumlupinar that has faced to this huge impact, started sinking from front compartments. And she couldn't resist the huge collision and sunk to the Dardanelles straits' dark waters in seconds. But some of the crew was survived and locked themselves to stern torpedo room. There was a huge explosion in the central compartment of Dumlupinar that makes her sink faster. There was no electricity. The sailors that saw the submarine was taking water from bow, tried to reach to the stern. They lost a lot of their friends while trying to reach the stern torpedo compartment. While Dumlupinar was sinking, 22 sailors reached the stern torpedo compartment.

Same night, the Custom's ship that was anchored in the Eceabat Harbour, was warned by a small motor ship. The person on the ship told them about the collision near Nara and asked them to get to the scene. When the ship reached to the collision area, the sea was like a circus area. All of Naboland's rescue boats were on sea, they have threw their phosphorus life jackets to sea and fired a lot of flares. Custom's ship has taken on board the rescued sailors from Dumlupinar who was on the sea or rescued by the rescue boats. The sailors have been taken to the hospitals around very quickly. But still there was 81 person under the water, no one knows if they were still alive or not. There was nothing else to do but to hope that they were alive and they call the "Kurtaran" (Rescuer) ship, the submarine rescue ship.

The sun had started to rise in Nara bay. Because of the light weather the fishing boats around the area saw the emergency communication buoy thrown by Dumlupinar while she was sinking. The custom's ship went directly to the comm. buoy and the second handsman of the customs ship Selim Yoluduz reached for the phone located inside of the comm. buoy and read the inscription on it that says "Dumlupinar submarine commissioned to the Turkish Navy sunk here, Open the hatch and contact with submarine". He opened the hatch and took the phone and started to talk with hope.

The customs officer waiting an answer has been relax when he heard the answer: "Yes, I am Lieutenant Selami". Getting the answer what he was waiting, Selim Yoluduz asked to the Lt. Selami about their condition. The answer that he got was explaining the horrible condition in Dumllupinar. Lt. Selami told him that the submarine was staying still 15 degrees to starboard, that their electricity was off and they were 22 persons in the stern torpedo room. Selim Yoluduz told him that they were in the Nara bay of Canakkale and their submarine was in approximately 90 meters depth. He said "don't worry we will get you out of there. Kurtaran (The Rescuer) is on its way." The words that Lt. Selami told him has been written to his ears and heart : "We salute our families. We know that you will save us. For our country..."

This was the first conversation of Lt Selami with the people on the surface. The people hope was fading out while the rescue tries of the Kurtaran ship that came approximately 11:00 was giving out no results. After the first conversation the people talked to Lt Selami were in order Canakkale Sea Forces Admiral Zeki Adar, Selim Yoluduz and second captain of the Inonu I Submarine, Suat Tezcan. While the time of alive crew at stern was passing slowly and their oxygen too, they were ordered to no talking, singing or smoking for using their oxygen economically, the hopes were fading out on the surface. Although surface and rescue crew says: there was no hesitate or sadness in the voice of Lt. Selami. After a while for another conversation: they reached for the phone. The sounds coming was like they were waiting for their will. They were praying. Surface crew explained the situation to alive crew with same words "You can talk, sing even you can smoke"Approximately at 15:00 the cable that was holding the communication buoy broke. There would be no other news from Dumlupinar...

The words "For our country" was the last words heard from the Dumlupinar lying in 84 meters depth. After the accident, when Admiral Sadik Altincan, Governor Safaeddin Karnakci and other authorities arrived to the region, the rescue operations started. In the mean time Inonu 1 submarine who didn't notice the accident returned to the accident region to help the rescue operations. There were other ships on the water to help the rescue operations. The rescue operations continued in the drafty waters of Canakkale but this efforts couldn't save the crew of Dumlupinar. Divers unsuccessfully attempted to secure a rescue apparatus to the stricken submarine.

At 2:15 AM Tuesday morning, three days after the initial accident, the rising CO2 levels inside the submarine would have killed any surviving crew. The rescue operation was abandoned. The following day at 15:00 a ceremony was held on the ship "Basaran".

Surface crew explained the situation to alive crew with same words "You can talk, sing even you can smoke"Approximately at 15:00 the cable that was holding the communication buoy broke. There would be no other news from Dumlupinar...The words "For our country" was the last words heard from the Dumlupinar lying in 84 meters depth. After the accident, when Admiral Sadik Altincan, Governor Safaeddin Karnakci and other authorities arrived to the region, the rescue operations started. In the mean time Inonu 1 submarine who didn't notice the accident returned to the accident region to help the rescue operations. There were other ships on the water to help the rescue operations. The rescue operations continued in the drafty waters of Canakkale but this efforts couldn't save the crew of Dumlupinar. Divers unsuccessfully attempted to secure a rescue apparatus to the stricken submarine.At 2:15 AM Tuesday morning, three days after the initial accident, the rising CO2 levels inside the submarine would have killed any surviving crew. The rescue operation was abandoned. The following day at 15:00 a ceremony was held on the ship "Basaran".

story:
Try to dream with me:

Dream of a world with electricity created with force of gravity, natural and emissions 0! anytime, anywhere !! What are you thinking? it makes me shudder .... True ???

I'm Daniele Rossi, I'm 26 years old and live in Brescia Italy.

Ever since I was little I have many ideas to which a lot of work, the last few years I've invented and I am building a machine that can produce electricity from the force of gravity.

The idea of being able to produce electricity in emissions 0 exploiting what nature offers us excite me so much that does not make me sleep at night, and invest all my savings

To continue in the studies and construction need of funds.

Can you imagine a world with electricity completely clean?


What We Need & What You Get

As I was saying the funds that I need are many and they are required to:

- Fully commit my time to the project

- Build a team of engineers and experts

- Idea development through professional software

- Construction of the sample 0 in the scale, in part already built to test during studies

- Development and implementation of a possible power test


The advantages of this invention may be many, I try to list a few:

- Production of clean electricity

- Energy production anywhere in the world and without climatic, or other

- Preservation of the planet, emissions 0

- Development and growth of countries and companies with the use of cheap energy

- Development of third world countries using low energy consumption


Risks & Challenges

The risks and challenges faced so far have been many, but the desire to do and the basic idea always push me to continue

Are still many obstacles, but with the right team together enough money to be able to finish this fantastic project

as you seen, the campaign does not have many materials, it was a choice Because It Has Often tried to copy me or steal my idea

In this days i'll work to load material not copyable


Other Ways You Can Help

Not everyone will be aware of the project will contribute economically

This does not mean that you can help:

Spoken of this project with friends, colleagues, acquaintances

share on social

and all other systems that you can think of !!

I recommend you use the tools of sharing Indiegogo !!!


My family says I'm crazy, but this dream is too good !!

As they say, the difference between dreams and goals is the expiration date!!!


I just have to hope to meet many dreamers like me!!!

Thank you very much!!

Daniele

story:
The Gist:

This little guy is an orphan that was abandoned at my veterinary hospital in town.  His mom was killed.  Fortunately, someone took the time to find him.  He has been transported to a location several hundred miles away to be raised until he can be set free in the wild.  Eastern Oregon needs a facility where injured, orphaned or abandoned animal can find safety and security.

We Need

A Wildlife Rescue & Rehabilitation Facility:

  A wild animal that has been hit by a car, trapped, wounded or shot, gets dropped off in our clinic.  We’ve had cougar kittens and wolf puppies, hawks, eagles and everything in between.

  A separate, designated, wildlife rehabilitation facility would allow us the ability to give them the proper medical treatment and rehabilitation necessary to relocate them or reintroduce them back into the wild.

  A Veterinary Hospital that is busy with family pets is no place for a wounded Fox, Eagle or Wolf.  The family animals are traumatized by wildlife sounds and smells - The wildlife want to eat the pets.  …It’s a no-win situation.   

I've been working in the veterinary profession for several years now and I LOVE my job, but I’ve discovered some unsettling things about the industry in these parts.

1).  There is NO wildlife rescue for hundreds of miles.

2).  There is no Pet Cemetery.

3).  There isn’t a Pet Crematorium either.

“Aunt Edna” is cremated in the same oven that “Mittens” is.

…and it costs a fortune.

Worse Still?

You have no choice to bury them if you can’t put them in your yard.

Animals that are put to sleep but the owner can’t afford to cremate them ARE THROWN IN THE DUMPSTER!!

They end up in the landfill like garbage 

We need a Pet Cemetery:

With your help:

A growing group of animal lovers in Eastern Oregon would be able to build a wildlife rescue center PLUS a pet cemetery with a crematorium on the same parcel of land.  (Hopefully, 40+ acres).

A pet cemetery will allow pet owners the ability to observe the ritual of a funeral, visit their beloved pet anytime they desired, grieve and heal.  It would also provide beloved pets the dignity and respect of place that they deserve - to rest.

Living paycheck to paycheck shouldn’t mean you have to throw Mittens in the garbage after she gave you a lifetime of love.

A crematorium would allow pets to be cremated in their own facility and returned to you in their own urn.

But we haven’t addressed the biggest issue …

The Chemicals used to Euthanize Pets,

also kill Eagles, Coyotes, Wolves

& Other Wildlife that feed at the Dump! 

Wildlife Rescue & Pet Cemetery!

  A wildlife rescue facility that is located on the same property as the pet cemetery would allow us to enter into a co-op with the local Veterinarians.  Veterinary Doctors would volunteer 10 clinic or emergency hours a month plus 24 on–call hours, in exchange for being able to bury animals abandoned at their clinics or offer affordable options to their clients.

  Wild animals being rehabilitated adjacent to a cemetery won’t bother local residents with their noise or late night activity.

  The plan is to have a split design that allows serenity and privacy for pet owners, yet also has facilities on another part of the land.

Two HUGE needs filled with

· One Caretaker,

· One Security Officer

· ONE Tax Bill.  

 

What Gets Us Started:

*Estimations:

·  $80,000  The Land

(hopefully 40+ acres)

·  $1,200.00  Architectural Plans

(Building Plans are almost done, but we need street names)!

·  $800.00  Plot design and street layout

(Ideas and suggestions welcome)!

·  $1,500.00  Permits

(The usual Bureaucratic requirements)  (Ha! I didn’t swear!  I’m proud of me!

·  $150,000  Construction crew, materials and pavers.

Got friends in construction who are on standby to build a   

·  Building with front office and mausoleum.

§  (Need bricks with names).

·  Caretaker’s Cottage

§  (So someone will be on the grounds, on call 24/7).

·  Shed for equipment.

§  (Tractor (used), Lawn Equipment, Coffins etc.)

·  Barn for wildlife with cages, kennels, feed, and vet office.

·  Crematorium

*We’ve done our research, but estimations are as close as we can get until we find the land and see what we have to work with.  We’re negotiating tractors, tools and equipment now.

 

  What We’ve Done!

  We’ve already set the wheels in motion!  We have a building in town where people can drop off wounded animals (or deceased pets).  Our building is located on Main Street so people don’t have to drive 30 miles to drop off wounded animals or pets.  We have found that if it’s convenient – people will do it.  

  The building is in the middle of town close to local Veterinary Hospitals who can help in an emergency before we transport them to the rehabilitation facility.

  The public is ALWAYS welcome to visit the cemetery if they so desire – this just makes life easier for those who can’t get out to the rural location.

If we reach only partial goals – here’s what’s most important.

*  The first $80,000.00 will secure the land.

*  $2,000.00 more will get the designs and architectural drawings for the buildings and the landscaping of the first section.

*  The rest of the money goes to the permits and contractors.

  The Impact

1)  Injured wildlife would have a higher survival rate if we had a designated facility run by professional, medically trained personnel attending to wounds and injuries.

2)  There would be a choice to bury your pet - not throw them away!

3)  Animals that were euthanized would not contaminate the wildlife by being thrown into food-chain via landfill.

4)  Grieving families and other visitors could visit pets, have a place to meditate quietly, picnic or just enjoy.

Services would include interment, above ground vaults, gift shop, tombstone services, coffin selection – including green coffins.

Wildlife would be attended to by veterinarians and other trained professionals.

Schools could schedule field trips and see what goes on behind the scenes of a wildlife center.

 Some people just can’t contribute, but that doesn’t mean they can’t help:

SPREAD THE WORD! PLEASE!  Facebook!  Twitter!  Instagram!  Email!

A rock through your neighbor's window!  Whatever works!

  If you are unable to financially contribute to the campaign, please

  at least share our link.

story:
The Green Zionist Alliance

The Green Zionist Alliance, a North America-based 501(c)3 nonprofit, offers a place for all people — regardless of political or religious affiliation — who care about humanity's responsibility to preserve the Earth and the special responsibility of the Jewish people to preserve the ecology of Israel. The GZA works to educate and mobilize people around the world for Israel’s environment; to protect Israel's environment and support its environmental movement; to improve environmental practices within the World Zionist Organization and its constituent agencies; and to inspire people to work for positive change. By focusing on the environment while working from a pluralistic and multicultural base, the Green Zionist Alliance seeks to bridge the differences between and within religions and people — helping to build a peaceful and sustainable future for Israel and the Middle East.

Interfaith Climate Conference and Jewish Clergical Advocacy

As an active member of both Interfaith Moral Action on Climate and the National Religious Coalition for Creation Care, the Green Zionist Alliance is already among the most active Jewish-environmental groups in interfaith work. Serving in the role of convener, the GZA intends to:

  • Host an interfaith conference for clergy in the Northeastern United States.
  • Follow up with Jewish clergy to help launch a Jewish clergical voice for smart climate policy. 

Goals

  • Increase environmental-advocacy cooperation between clergy.
  • Establish a Jewish clergical voice on environmental issues.

Learn more

Learn more about the work of the Green Zionist Alliance at: http://www.greenzionism.org

story:
There is no "THEY" Only "US"

  Only "WE" can make this Happen

                                   

About Us

Established in 2010, Current Energy is an eco-conscious company specializing in Solar Thermal energy systems for residential, recreational, commercial and industrial uses. As well as the owner and operator of this company, I am also a Secondary School teacher in the discipline of Technology Education. To top that off, I am also the Lead for the largest Technology Department in my School Board.

For decades we have watched the environment deteriorate in the name of “human progress”. We are rapidly depleting our fossil fuel supplies and exploiting our planet as we consume from it. Moses Henry Cass said, “We have not inherited this earth from our parents to do with it what we will. We have borrowed it from our children and we must be careful to use it in their interests as well as our own.”

At Current Energy, we believe it is our responsibility to teach the next generation to leverage the sustainable resources around them and build towards a cleaner and brighter future we can all live with.
 
 
 

 

 

Our Products

Solar thermal energy systems function differently than the traditional photovoltaic solar cell that most people are familiar with. Our systems consist of an array of evacuated glass tubes and a heat transfer medium. Our tubes feature a special coating that absorbs light energy from the sun and traps it inside. The energy is then transferred to glycol, water or copper heat pipes that move the converted light-to-heat energy to where it is needed.

 

Our Idea

By combining our knowledge of solar thermal energy and our love of teaching it is our goal to:

  • Supply the 900+ Ontario Secondary Schools with a Current Energy Solar Tube Kit & Education package
  • Raise and create a $5,000 scholarship for secondary students pursuing education in alternative energy technology
  • Create an ‘Open Source Education Group’ for alternative energies so that any student or educator can benefit from this program, regardless of their geographic or financial situation.

 

Stretch Goals

Once our primary goals have been met, our second benchmark will enable us to expand the program. With your help we can:

  • Send out 10 Current Energy Solar Tube Kits & Education Packages to every secondary school in Ontario. This enables more students and teachers to work together using evacuated tube solar collectors for in-class experiments.
  • Expand the scholarship fund to support a minimum of $5,000 in yearly payouts. To achieve this we believe critical mass funding must be in excess of $100,000.
  • Include additional alternative energy solutions in the educational package.

Why Should You Care?

We have one chance to do right by our Earth and future generations. With enough people affecting a small change, it becomes bigger. After all, a grain of sand on its own is often overlooked, but enough grains of sand make a beach. More impact and more significance.  If we educate students about the possibilities that technology can produce for them, we all benefit. Our students will be better equipped to handle the need for sustainable and affordable energy. We will substantially decrease our carbon footprint and the damage we’re causing to the environment. The cost of energy will come down for homeowners, businesses and industries. And lastly, we will have contributed to leaving the world a better place than we found it. You and I can effect change. Together we can make a difference.

Why Choose Us?

We can’t sit idly and watch energy prices soar at the cost of our environment. We want to be the launch pad for something amazing. We can all be part of something that has meaning, worth and value. For Current Energy it's teaching today’s technology to the future of the planet. We have the knowledge, the materials and the ability to make this happen. Most importantly, we have the passion to see it through. You can help enlighten students and make the world a better place. What we need from you is buy-in and we can take it from there.

Where Does Your Money Go?

We guarantee that your pledges will:

Put Solar Thermal Kits into the hands of high school students across the province. 

Help to complete the Educational Package by hiring specialists in other subject areas to share and create exciting, meaningful and relevant learning materials

Regardless of us meeting our fundraising goal, the Educational Package will be finished and supporters will see their pledges delivered.

 

Why Indiegogo.com?

Indiegogo.com is a fantastic outlet to connect with millions of people, share ideas and help get meaningful creative projects off the ground. It is also as a place where awareness can be raised about community issues and initiatives. For us, Indiegogo.com makes sense.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you are not able to contribute financially it doesn’t mean you can’t help with the cause! Share a link to our project, make some noise and look into how you can help make the world a better place. We’re all in it together so let’s make it great!

Thank you for your time and consideration,

Stephen Pressey

Teacher of Ontario Secondary Students

Owner/Operator of Current Energy

 
________________________________________________________________________

Perks

Note: Solar Thermal Units are Available right after pledging.  Some units sell out quickly depending on the time of year and may have to be manufactured. Delivery date to be determined if out stock.  Transportation will have to be arranged.  Thank you. 

Educational Solar Tube Kit

 LS60 Solar Thermal Unit

 
 

PHS180 Solar Thermal Unit

 
 

VTC200A Vertical Pool Solar Thermal Unit

 
 

SPSS20 and HPC200 Thermal Unit

 
 

  HPC200 Solar Thermal Unit

 
 
 
When the goal of $5,000 is reached, scholarships will be available for the 2014 school year. Rebates available to business owners (non-residential) through Ontario Government programs. Our goal is to have 10 packages in every school in Ontario (10,000 units) by 2014.
 
*Solar Units plumbing and installation not included. Free delivery within 100 km of Barrie, Ontario. Personal Education Solar Tube Kits have additional shipping fees outside Ontario.

story:
Background and Project Summary

My husband and I met in Brazil 8 years ago, my husband (Toty) is from Argentina but had at which point been living in the local area for many years.  I am from the UK, and had been travelling through South America, but when I came to this beautiful little town in Bahia, Brazil, I also fell in love with it.  However, over the years we have seen more tourists arriving and more foreign investment which has undoubted positively helped the local area financially with more locals now working within the tourist industry, however along with this we have also seen the negative impact on the local natural environment, and how once preserved nearby mata-atlantic (forest areas) are being bought up by hotels, and foreign investors, resulting in much of nature being burnt down to allow for builds, the rates of deforestation in Brazil is frightening and we need your help to be part of the solution and not the problem. 

It upsets us to see locals and visitors to the area neglecting the beautiful natural environment.  There's an increase in trash now visible on the streets, and many people don't yet understand the need for recycling and re-use.  Local children are not being educated to help protect and cherish their local environment, and local people are building their homes using man made environmentally unfriendly materials, which are not only more expensive and therefore difficult for them to buy, but are also having a negative impact on the environment. People do not yet understand the benefits of sustainable energy and water solutions, and massive wastage of both energy and water in the area is clearly visible.

Over the past few years we have been researching and developing the eco-Taipe project, getting support from local people, and we hope it will help create a solution to this problem.  We have found and bought the perfect piece of land which would otherwise have been bought by a foreign investor ready to burn it down and build an ugly tourist report.  Instead we want to use this space to create Eco-Taipe.

Eco-Taipe will be an eco friendly, self sufficient and sustainable living, working and social environment built to co-exist in complete harmony with its stunning natural mata-atlantic surroundings. It will house local and international people alike who want to visit us, work with us and learn the principles of permaculture, bio construction and sustainable living.  

Our workshops will help locals to cultivate their own land and build using bio construction methods which are more cost effective.

The project will supporting local culture and traditions, hosting events and activities that will promote and celebrate Brazilian/Bahian culture, art and traditions. 

Eco Taipe Project will create local recycling initiatives, getting local residents involved. Promoting the environmental and economic benefits of recycling, showing them how recycled products can be used in building and art projects, and can even provid income.

The childrens project will work with the support of some of the local schools whereby children will come to Eco-Taipe to learn about the environment and protecting it, help on the land growing fruits and vegetables in their own organic patch, and have fun learning how to recycle and the great ways which we can re-use waste.

What We Need and What You Get

We saved the initial start-up capital purchase the land, and can support the first set of 15 volunteers who are joining the project in Oct and will stay with us until Dec to prepare the land creating the initial infrastructure.  However we need your help to make this project an ongoing success and to fulfill all the key objectives of it.

We need a further £20,000 to really make the project a success, and make it sustainable.  Your donations will go towards the following:

  • BASIC FACILITIES: Using sustainable energy and water solutions including water well, solar panels, grey water solutions
  • TRANSPORT: 2nd hand vehicle to transport volunteers, materials, and safely transport children from local schools to the Eco Taipe for the children's eco awareness program
  • TOOLS & MATERIALS: Sustainable materials like hyper adobe bags for bio construction  tools for building and agriculture
  • VOLUNTEERS: Accommodation, food and water for hungry and hardworking volunteers, enabling us to continue to offer the volunteering project free to volunteers thus making it accessible to local volunteers too.
  • TRANSPORT: 2nd hand vehicle to transport volunteers, materials, and safely transport children from local schools to the Eco Taipe for the childrens eco awareness program
  • SPECIALISTS:  Needed for the first 3 months to guide volunteers, and train us up on permaculture and bio construction methods enable us to continue the teachings.

  • LEGALITIES: Land Typography,  planning processes and regulations.

    Even if we don't make the full contribution on Indigogo, we won't stop there, with some initial funding we can start the project and use some of the fund to get publicity and help us get further backing from other sources. We will not stop Eco Taipe will be an ongoing project that it deserves to be!

    If you can donate please do, no matter how small the contribution.  And in return for your contribution there are varying levels of perks from certificates, from Eco friendly T-shirts to stays at Eco Taipe.

    Other Ways You Can Help

    • Perhaps you really want to help but you don't have the time or opportunity to offer to actually volunteer, and perhaps you don't have the money to offer a contribution, but you can still help... Please help us get the word out and make some noise about your campaign, you can use the Indiegogo share tools to spread the word across facebook, twitter and please share the link to our project with as many people as possible to make Eco Taipe Project a success story!

    Please support us by clicking on, liking and sharing our Facebook Page

water for hungry and hardworking volunteers, enabling us to continue to offer the volunteering project free to volunteers thus making it accessible to local volunteers too.

If you can donate please do, no matter how small the contribution.  And in return for your contribution there are varying levels of perks from certificates, from Eco friendly T-shirts to stays at Eco Taipe.
Other Ways You Can Help


Perhaps you really want to help but you don't have the time or opportunity to offer to actually volunteer, and perhaps you don't have the money to offer a contribution, but you can still help... Please help us get the word out and make some noise about your campaign, you can use the Indiegogo share tools to spread the word across facebook, twitter and please share the link to our project with as many people as possible to make Eco Taipe Project a success story!

Please support us by clicking on, liking and sharing our Facebook Page

story:
My Request

I am requesting donations to write a mermaid book that inspires people to care for the waters of planet earth by connecting with their creative imagination and the spirit in nature. I see a great need for playful, magical, and positive healing approaches to stewardship of Mother Earth’s waters.

 

The Mermaid Book

The main character of the book is a mermaid named Brita who cares for the waters of Mother Earth. Brita teaches us about how to nurture and care for our water especially our source waters and our “inner waters”—or our emotional self. Brita heals people’s inner-waters with her joy and magic. She has many adventures, and she takes us along for the ride—or swim!

 

Who Benefits

All living things benefit from this project. For over ten years, I have been part of a  movement of people, projects, new consciousness that is teaching and re-connecting children and adults with the sacredness of nature, our planet, and waters. I’d like to see more children involved including the inner-children of adults. Caring for the earth and her waters must be our top priority.

 

How This Project Will Help The World

One important teaching is that to take care of our planet, we must come from a joyful place, a place of nurturing care and concern. The old stories of guilt, blame, and shame… or judgment no longer serve us. It is time for peaceful contributions to be offered and accepted. Let’s inspire each other with our creativity!

 

Healing Our Hearts

The mermaid book also addresses the personal healing of our inner emotions—or inner-waters. (Humans are composed of more than 77% water. What we think or feel is “broadcast” out in the world, carried by the water.) When we are activated to heal ourselves and open our creative energies, we become healthy, happy, and available for healing others and all living things. Whether a male or female, Brita can teach us to honor and appreciate our intuitive, feminine feeling gifts, or right brain.

 

My Background of Service to Mother Earth

I am a writer, small business owner, alternative healer, teacher, and mother of a teenage son. I have a deep commitment to being a voice for the plant kingdom and its medicine and teachings, and for the water. For many years I have been helping people with emotional healing using flower essences that I created. Flower essences are a flower-based plant medicine that is carried in water and popularized by Dr. Bach in the 1930s.

 

3 Flowers Healing LLC

Since 1997, I have been self-employed in my own company that creates flower essences and aromatherapy products in Oregon and Washington. (www.3flowershealing.com) I have created over 200 flower essence “medicines” and aromatherapy products. I am a flower essence maker/alchemist, certified aromatherapist, flower essence practitioner, alternative medicine healer, and Reiki Master. Currently, I have two managers running my business in the Portland, Oregon area.

I teach classes and workshops on my Columbia River Gorge Flower Essences, Hawaiian Creation Essences, water healing, communing with nature, wildflower walks, and fairy and herb camps. I have taught apprentices in flower essence therapy and wrote and self-published a book “Listening to the Wildflowers: Guide to the Columbia River Gorge Flower Essences.” My work helps people reconnect with nature and the spirit in nature.

 

Traveling on Behalf of the Waters

These last few years, I have been traveling full-time with my partner, a Native American ceremonial leader, doing ceremony for the water and Mother Earth. We have been traveling in California, Pacific Northwest, Canada, and the Southwest and have dedicated our lives to be in service by teaching and catalyzing others to honor and care for Mother Earth and her living waters. We receive a small income when we teach and donations for ceremony we lead. Our expenses are low yet we are not bringing in enough to cover our expenses. You can learn more about the ceremonies we do at www.waterwheelceremony.com or at Marshall “Golden Eagle” Jack’s website  www.goldeneagleceremonies.com

 

My Dream

My dream is to write a mermaid book—as a voice for the spirit of the waters. I feel I am destined to write books that will contribute towards positive change and healing for our planet. The book about Brita the Mermaid will offer a launching pad for the message of caring for the waters to be broadcast to many more people. I am not only excited about writing but about teaching, speaking, doing interviews, and spreading mermaid Brita’s message worldwide!

 

My Plan

I will use the $12,000 I raise to pay off some debt, travel to inspiring mermaid lands, and free up time to write.

See my websites & blog:

www.3flowershealing.com  my flower essences & aromatherapy business

www.waterwheelceremony.com ceremony and teachings for the waters 500 years into the future

http://camillearthstar.blogspot.com my new blog exploring the elementals, fairies, mermaids, gnomes, dragons, and nature spirits.

 

Mermaid Artist Cher Lyn, thank youfor your amazing painting of the mermaid. Support mermaid art by purchasing her art or cards. www.mysticartmedicine.com

story:
***WE ARE SO GRATEFUL FOR YOUR SUPPORT AND GENEROSITY.***

***WE'VE RAISED $15,000 & DOUBLED OUR GOAL TO $30,000!*** 

***WE STILL NEED YOUR HELP! REVEREND BILLY AND NEHEMIAH ARE FACING SERIOUS CHARGES.***

Activists Reverend Billy and Nehemiah Luckett, from The Church of Stop Shopping, face charges of riot in the second degree, menacing in the third degree, unlawful assembly, and two counts of disorderly conduct for a nonviolent songful performance in a midtown Manhattan JPMorgan Chase lobby. The dancing, singing toads offered bank workers and customers information about the impact of Chase investments on the environment while singing about extinction, climate change and the emergency of the earth. 

The New York City District Attorney’s office is requesting one year in prison for "this criminal stunt." Attorney Wylie Stecklow insists that the, "15 minutes of performance art about the Earth's crisis," was well within, "expressive political activity," protected by the 1st Amendment of the United States Constitution.  At a preliminary hearing the two lawyers went back and forth: "Art!" "Crime!" "Art!" "Crime!" "Art!" 

Chase Bank is one of the worlds top financiers of extractive industrial projects, thought to be responsible for more CO2 emissions released into the atmosphere than any other single institution, with the possible exception of the Chinese Government.  The Church of Stop Shopping believes we must highlight the role of Big Banks in The Climate Crisis and offer workers within the fossil fuel cartel research we've gathered from sources such as BankTrack.Org and the World Development Movement

Show support for the Reverend and Nehemiah by donating to our legal fund!!  Money raised here will go to the legal teams costs (as individuals they are working pro bono) as well as  those incurred by the Church of Stop Shopping as we bring the story of the Golden Toad and Climate Change to the world.

We must take a stand for activism, for non-violent direct action and freedom of expression during this time of accelerated climate crisis. 

Join us.

With Gratitude,

Reverend Billy, Nehemiah & Friends of the Church of Stop Shopping


P.S.  We also have a petition we urge you to sign: https://www.change.org/petitions/reverend-billy-faces-one-year-in-jail-asks-for-petition-signatures

story:
What is Bosque Fluir (Flowing Forest)?

Flowing Forest is a permaculture project open to all people that want to have an authentic experience of connection with peace, beauty and biodiversity of the amazonic nature, located in the highlands of Sauce, Peru, with the view of the blue lagoon (laguna azul).

Who is in charge?

I am Diego Oroch, a young journalist, conservationist and music lover. Before I arrived here, I had many volunteering experiences through the Peruvian Jungle and in Lima. When I was finishing my career, feeling overwhelmed from living in Lima, a big city of 10 million people, somebody that loves me, told me: “Create the life you want to live” and here I am. On August 2018 I made the first step to create a crazy Green Project; a space to live in harmony with the amazon rainforest and invite people to listen to their self nature. 

With the support of my family, friends and neighbors we are dealing with the challenge to protect the forest from the threat of deforestation, and making it a space of harmony, cooperation for the animals and plants of the Amazonas. I hope to open the forest for exploring and to teach  alternative sustainable living.

What is the dream that inspired us?

The main objective is to create a self-sustainable space, where anyone can live as a brotherhood sharing in a healthy and natural way, learning to live sustainably, take care of mother earth, have fun, chill, heal naturally, view upon the birds and flowers. An environment that allows us to find our equilibrium in our lives and express our creativity.

Bosque Fluir is going to open the eyes of the district of Sauce to concepts of sustainability, like permaculture, bio-construction, collection and filtering of rainwater, solar energy, and nature medicine. Also, the use of a compost area and uses of used water to avoid any pollution.

Here we have a responsibility to restore our surroundings, for species in danger and medical trees. That’s why we create an area of conservation, reforesting and education. The wood that we’re using is coming from the surroundings and we’re going to plant another tree for every tree used.

Because we are located in the high jungle, we are going to offer an experience that won’t be forgotten through submersion into the amazon. For example, there exists a pleasent natural stream that flows through the rear of the Flowing Forest for around 250 meters. Us, along with animal life are dependent on this stream.

Flowing Forest is going to offer several activities such as yoga, meditation, music, painting, wellness workshops, classes for cooking sustainable cuisine with organic products, and more. From here you can rest from a birds eye view from a platform in the trees or hike to see beautiful waterfalls.

The fruit farm tours will be within our hectares of 20 different kind of fruit trees. Including cacao, pineapple, avocado, coffee, mandarine, and many jungle fruits (majambo, pijuayo, anona, and more). All the fruit we grow are grown without chemicals or pesticides.

Connection with the environment:

Build a sustainable space that shares better practices on conservation, where the visitors can participate and have benefits from the bioconstruction, the rainwater, solar energy, garden and farm. Apart from that breath clean air thanks to our reforestation project.

Activities to connect with and enjoy the nature: Having a shower in the waterfall, herbs baths, birdwatching and climbing trees.

Connection with others:

Volunteering: The idea is to build this dream with volunteers from all over the world. We want to include people from all different cultures, origins, ages and professions with the same compromise of conservation. Also we propose guidelines to follow the sumak kawsay. (good living)

Harmonious and communitarian coexistence. We are going to have coexisting agreements, to have a conscious experience without drugs, alcohol, weapons, and the least plastic possible.

The plan for Flowing Forest is to not be exclusive, it is for people like Diego, nature lovers, adventurous by heart, and people with lots of desire to learn and share.

Connection with yourself:

Yoga and meditation: in the beginning or/and in the end of the day.

Forest baths - including dance and Mindfulness.

Emotional workshops and non-violent communication.

Conscious feed: Cooking workshops with sustainable organic products

What we have done:

House: For now, we have a communitary space where four people can sleep, but we’re projecting to build little houses made of mud, wood, bamboo, and palm leaves, and also install a couple of comfortable tents. We’re also planning to build a big house of two floors for ten people, made for volunteers and guests. All these buildings are going to have an eco-friendly dry bathroom.

Paths: Inside the 7 hectares, we are designing trails and buildings to do the activities we already mentioned.

What we need:

Volunteers wanting to help:

Hands, brains and hearts that want to help with building, farming, reforesting, and putting the space in order. Who can stay living while our agreement of mutual collaboration lasts.

Financial support: 

We are asking for 5,000 euros for now because we need to start as soon as possible, but in reality it is more necessary to finish the project as we imagine it.

Our main objectives are to build a place to receive guests and volunteers in a comfortable space. To cure and take care of the fruit trees that already produce organic fruits. Reforest an area full of an invasive plant species. Construct bungalows, malocas, and bathrooms. And create a water system to supply for the main areas

Necessities:

Bungalows: €1,000 for materials and the salary of the workers.

Maloca: €4,000 for materials, salaries, (Malocas are large circular buildings designed for yoga, dance, meditation, and other group activities.

Water system: €1,000 for tubes and the instillation of the water system. Filtration for drinkable water and the construction of dry bathrooms with sinks.

Reforestation: €1,000 for the transportation of plants, removal of the invasive plants, and to buy tools and to plant trees.

Medicinal Garden: €500 for clearing the area and transportation of plants.

Renewable energy: €2,000 to buy solar panels, batteries and energy converters.

Materials for wellness activities: €500 for buying materials for yoga and meditation.

We estimate that it will cost €10,000 to complete the first step of the Flowing Forest.

Other Ways You Can Help

  • All this would be possible with your help! If you support it will be good for the planet and if you know who would be interested in supporting, please share.
  • You can use the Indiegogo share tools!

Web: http://www.danielochoa.pe/bosquefluir.com

Facebook: https://web.facebook.com/Bosque-Fluir

¿Qué es el Bosque Fluir?

Es un proyecto de permacultura abierto a todas las personas que deseen tener una experiencia auténtica de conexión con la paz, la belleza y la biodiversidad que caracteriza a la naturaleza amazónica, ubicada en las parte alta del distrito de Sauce en la región San Martín, con vista a la Laguna Azul.

¿Quién dirige este proyecto?

Soy Diego Oroch , un joven comunicador, conservacionista y melómano. Antes de llegar aquí hice muchos trabajos de voluntariado recorriendo el Perú. Cuando estaba terminando mis estudios en la universidad, un poco agobiado por vivir en Lima, una selva de cemento de 10 millones de habitantes, alguien que me quiere me dijo: “Invéntate una vida que te guste” y aquí estoy. En agosto del 2018 di un primer paso en la creación de un loco proyecto verde; un espacio para vivir en armonía con el bosque amazónico e invitar a los demás a escuchar su naturaleza interior.

Con el apoyo de mi familia, amigos y vecinos estamos afrontando el reto de proteger el bosque de las amenazas de la deforestación y afianzarlo como un espacio de convivencia armoniosa de la fauna y flora amazónica con las personas del mundo. Se trata de abrir el bosque para explorar y enseñar alternativas de vida sostenible.

¿Cuál es el sueño que nos inspira?

Nuestro objetivo es construir un espacio autosustentable donde se puede convivir en hermandad de manera sana y natural, compartiendo el cuidado por la madre tierra, disfrutando de la acción y la aventura en la naturaleza, así como la contemplación de ella. Un entorno que permita encontrar nuestro equilibrio, sirva para inspirarse y expresarse creativamente.

El Bosque Fluir ampliará la visión del distrito hacia conceptos de sostenibilidad, tales como la permacultura, la bio-construcción, la recolección y el filtrado de agua de lluvia, la energía solar, la medicina natural. Además del uso de compostera y reutilización de las aguas residuales para evitar toda contaminación.

Estamos comprometidos a la reforestación y la replantación del lugar, con especies en peligro de extinción o árboles con propiedades medicinales. Así creamos las áreas de reforestación, conservación y educación. La madera que utilizamos proviene de los árboles de los alrededores y se volverá a plantar otro árbol por cada árbol talado.

Al estar ubicado en la selva alta, propondremos una experiencia inolvidable de inmersión en fauna y flora amazónica con excursiones entre plataformas en árboles, caminatas a bellas cataratas, recorridos agroforestales y más. Además, contamos con una piscina natural que está en uno de los bordes del terreno, muy indispensable para animales y humanos.

Boflu ofrecerá varias actividades como el yoga, la meditación, la música, el arte, talleres de bienestar, masajes, recorridos agroforestales y, en el huerto medicinal, clases de cocina sostenible con productos orgánicos locales y más. 

Los recorridos agroforestales se darán dentro de las dos hectáreas de 20 frutas diferentes que ya existen, entre los que se encuentra cacao, palta (aguacate), lúcuma, majambo, pijuayo, piña y más. Todas estas frutas que no tienen uso de ningún químico ni pesticida.

Conexión con el ambiente: 

Construir un espacio sostenible que irradie buenas prácticas de conservación en la zona y en los visitantes del bosque que participen en el trabajo y los beneficios de la bioconstrucción, recolección de agua de lluvia, energía solar, jardinería, y huerta orgánica. Además de la respirar aire puro gracias a la reforestación.

Actividades de conexión y disfrute en la naturaleza: Baños en la quebrada, Baños de hierbas, avistamiento de aves y rapel.

Conexión con los demás:

Voluntariado: La idea es construir este sueño con voluntari@s soñadores/as de todo el mundo. Queremos reunir personas de diferentes culturas, orígenes, edades y profesiones con el mismo compromiso de conservación. Además de proponer los principios equilibrados del sumak kawsay (buen vivir).

Convivencia armoniosa y comunitaria (visitantes). Vamos a practicar acuerdos de convivencia, para una experiencia individual consciente no llevar drogas, no consumo de alcohol. Además, no armas y reducir el plástico.

Conexión contigo mismo:

 Yoga y Meditación al inicio y/o final del día.

 Baños del bosque – Danza, Movimiento y Mindfulness.

Talleres de emociones y comunicación son violencia.

Alimentación consciente: talleres de cocina sostenible con productos orgánicos locales.

Lo que hemos avanzado: 

Alojamiento: Por ahora contamos con un espacio rústico de bienvenida donde pueden dormir 4 personas, pero se proyecta construir cabañas de barro, bambú, madera y shapaja (techo de hojas) y carpas rústicas seguras. Se construirán una casa grande para voluntarios y visitas que será de dos pisos para 10 personas y las bases de 2 cabañas pequeñas más. Cada una contará con baños secos y duchas cómodas.

Caminos: En las 7 hectáreas del Bosque Fluir estamos diseñando caminos y espacios para las actividades descritas.

Lo que necesitamos: 

El trabajo voluntario:

Manos, cerebros y corazones que quieran apoyar a construir, plantar, reforestar y ordenar el espacio. Quienes podrán quedarse mientras dure nuestro acuerdo mutuo de colaboración.

El aporte económico: 

Hemos calculado 5,000 euros para esta primera fase y necesitamos empezar lo antes posible, pero en realidad se necesitará más, para terminar el proyecto. 

Nuestros objetivos principales para esta fase son acondicionar el lugar para recibir visitantes y voluntarios en lugares amistosos donde puedan hacer una conexión en los tres niveles propuestos. Curar y cuidar los árboles frutales que ya nos proveen de frutas orgánicas. Reforestar el área invadida de plantas voluntarias (también conocidas como maleza). Construir las cabañas, la maloca y los baños. Y crear un sistema de agua que alimente a las áreas principales.

Necesidades:

Cabañas: €1,000 para materiales y el salario de constructores para cada cabaña.

Maloca: €4,000 para materiales, salarios, gran edificio circular para yoga, danza, meditación y diferentes actividades grupales.

Sistema de agua: €1,000 para la tubería y la instalación subterránea del agua de lluvia. Filtración para consumo, y la construcción de baños secos con lavatorios.

Reforestación: €1,000 en transportar plantones, remover la maleza, comprar herramientas y plantar.

Huerto medicinal: €500 para habilitar el espacio y traer las plantas.

Energías renovables: €2,000 para comprar paneles solares, baterías y convertidores e instalarlos.

Materiales de bienestar: €500 para comprar materiales de yoga, meditación.

Estimamos que serían €10,000 para completar la importantísima primera fase del Bosque Fluir.

Otras maneras de ayudar:

¡Todo esto es posible gracias a ustedes! Si desean apoyar, será algo genial para el planeta y si sabe a quienes les interesaría apoyar, ¡compártaselo! 

También puedes usar las herramientas de indiegogo para compartir o invitar gente a nuestro fanpage.

¡Gracias a todos!

Web: http://www.danielochoa.pe/bosquefluir.com

Facebook: https://web.facebook.com/Bosque-Fluir
story_txt:
What is Bosque Fluir (Flowing Forest)?
Flowing Forest is a permaculture project open to all people that want to have an authentic experience of connection with peace, beauty and biodiversity of the amazonic nature, located in the highlands of Sauce, Peru, with the view of the blue lagoon (laguna azul).

Who is in charge?
I am Diego Oroch, a young journalist, conservationist and music lover. Before I arrived here, I had many volunteering experiences through the Peruvian Jungle and in Lima. When I was finishing my career, feeling overwhelmed from living in Lima, a big city of 10 million people, somebody that loves me, told me: “Create the life you want to live” and here I am. On August 2018 I made the first step to create a crazy Green Project; a space to live in harmony with the amazon rainforest and invite people to listen to their self nature. 
With the support of my family, friends and neighbors we are dealing with the challenge to protect the forest from the threat of deforestation, and making it a space of harmony, cooperation for the animals and plants of the Amazonas. I hope to open the forest for exploring and to teach  alternative sustainable living.
What is the dream that inspired us?
The main objective is to create a self-sustainable space, where anyone can live as a brotherhood sharing in a healthy and natural way, learning to live sustainably, take care of mother earth, have fun, chill, heal naturally, view upon the birds and flowers. An environment that allows us to find our equilibrium in our lives and express our creativity.
Bosque Fluir is going to open the eyes of the district of Sauce to concepts of sustainability, like permaculture, bio-construction, collection and filtering of rainwater, solar energy, and nature medicine. Also, the use of a compost area and uses of used water to avoid any pollution.
Here we have a responsibility to restore our surroundings, for species in danger and medical trees. That’s why we create an area of conservation, reforesting and education. The wood that we’re using is coming from the surroundings and we’re going to plant another tree for every tree used.
Because we are located in the high jungle, we are going to offer an experience that won’t be forgotten through submersion into the amazon. For example, there exists a pleasent natural stream that flows through the rear of the Flowing Forest for around 250 meters. Us, along with animal life are dependent on this stream.
Flowing Forest is going to offer several activities such as yoga, meditation, music, painting, wellness workshops, classes for cooking sustainable cuisine with organic products, and more. From here you can rest from a birds eye view from a platform in the trees or hike to see beautiful waterfalls.
The fruit farm tours will be within our hectares of 20 different kind of fruit trees. Including cacao, pineapple, avocado, coffee, mandarine, and many jungle fruits (majambo, pijuayo, anona, and more). All the fruit we grow are grown without chemicals or pesticides.
Connection with the environment:
Build a sustainable space that shares better practices on conservation, where the visitors can participate and have benefits from the bioconstruction, the rainwater, solar energy, garden and farm. Apart from that breath clean air thanks to our reforestation project.
Activities to connect with and enjoy the nature: Having a shower in the waterfall, herbs baths, birdwatching and climbing trees.

Connection with others:
Volunteering: The idea is to build this dream with volunteers from all over the world. We want to include people from all different cultures, origins, ages and professions with the same compromise of conservation. Also we propose guidelines to follow the sumak kawsay. (good living)
Harmonious and communitarian coexistence. We are going to have coexisting agreements, to have a conscious experience without drugs, alcohol, weapons, and the least plastic possible.
The plan for Flowing Forest is to not be exclusive, it is for people like Diego, nature lovers, adventurous by heart, and people with lots of desire to learn and share.
Connection with yourself:
Yoga and meditation: in the beginning or/and in the end of the day.
Forest baths - including dance and Mindfulness.
Emotional workshops and non-violent communication.
Conscious feed: Cooking workshops with sustainable organic products
What we have done:
House: For now, we have a communitary space where four people can sleep, but we’re projecting to build little houses made of mud, wood, bamboo, and palm leaves, and also install a couple of comfortable tents. We’re also planning to build a big house of two floors for ten people, made for volunteers and guests. All these buildings are going to have an eco-friendly dry bathroom.

Paths: Inside the 7 hectares, we are designing trails and buildings to do the activities we already mentioned.
What we need:
Volunteers wanting to help:
Hands, brains and hearts that want to help with building, farming, reforesting, and putting the space in order. Who can stay living while our agreement of mutual collaboration lasts.
Financial support: 
We are asking for 5,000 euros for now because we need to start as soon as possible, but in reality it is more necessary to finish the project as we imagine it.
Our main objectives are to build a place to receive guests and volunteers in a comfortable space. To cure and take care of the fruit trees that already produce organic fruits. Reforest an area full of an invasive plant species. Construct bungalows, malocas, and bathrooms. And create a water system to supply for the main areas

Necessities:
Bungalows: €1,000 for materials and the salary of the workers.
Maloca: €4,000 for materials, salaries, (Malocas are large circular buildings designed for yoga, dance, meditation, and other group activities.
Water system: €1,000 for tubes and the instillation of the water system. Filtration for drinkable water and the construction of dry bathrooms with sinks.
Reforestation: €1,000 for the transportation of plants, removal of the invasive plants, and to buy tools and to plant trees.
Medicinal Garden: €500 for clearing the area and transportation of plants.
Renewable energy: €2,000 to buy solar panels, batteries and energy converters.
Materials for wellness activities: €500 for buying materials for yoga and meditation.
We estimate that it will cost €10,000 to complete the first step of the Flowing Forest.

Other Ways You Can Help

All this would be possible with your help! If you support it will be good for the planet and if you know who would be interested in supporting, please share.
You can use the Indiegogo share tools!

Web: http://www.danielochoa.pe/bosquefluir.com
Facebook: https://web.facebook.com/Bosque-Fluir
